body:
Spring is here! As always, you can count on Myer to be the authority on trends for the coming season. This Learning Moment covers nine of the key womenswear trends for spring/summer 2018, and will provide you with the tools you’ll need to educate your customers on how to wear these key pieces. Remember: we also have a great selection of MEB shoes and accessories in store to complement all of these S/S18 outfits.


We’ve got everyone's wardrobe needs covered for the warmer, more carefree months – a time when anything seems possible – so read on and get set to feel like new!
title: Text Title

body: Forget boring, stiff, job-interview-style suiting – the summer suiting trend is big for summer 2019. It's all about stylish, feminine cuts in on-trend fabrics and colours (think linen, pastels, stripes). Wear your matching suiting together to be on trend, or mix and match to create other looks, such as wearing a pastel-coloured blazer back with denim jeans.
title: Text Title

_items.body: Printed spice floral coordinate set by Piper Petites (top $79.95, pant $99.95; exclusive to Myer) requiring minimal adornment with neutral heels
Pinstripe summer suit with pull-on pant by Basque (jacket $139.95, pant $89.95; exclusive to Myer) looking the goods in classic black and white
Evita top and Avis pant by FWRD The Label (top $169, pant $299) doing contemporary floral coordinate set to stunning effect
Top and skirt with ruffle hem by Piper (top $89.95, skirt $99.95; exclusive to Myer) – the epitome of feminine floral and flourishes
Textured crepe summer suit by Basque (jacket $139.95, crop pant $89.95; exclusive to Myer), pretty in pink with a floral-print blouse

_items.text:
• A suit jacket is a wardrobe staple and a great investment piece. It’s versatile too, equally at home with denim jeans on the weekend or paired with matching pants for work.


• Add statement heels and earrings for the perfect race-day outfit, or keep things casual by teaming your matching blazer and pant with a simple white tee and trainers.


• Go matchy-matchy with your coordinate sets for head-to-toe flow, or mix and match with a solid-colour top or pant.

body:
❝

Have you thought about wearing head-to-toe colour? We have a beautiful pink Basque suit that you could try.


How about trying on this Piper floral set? You can wear it together or style it separately, creating three different looks.


❞
title: Text Title

body:
Summer suiting: Basque, Piper, Tokito and national brands and concessions


Coordinate sets: Piper, Miss Shop, Milk & Honey and national brands and concessions
title: Text Title

body: You’ve gotta love a trend where just one piece can create an entire outfit – and what a fun and fashion-forward outfit a jumpsuit is! Along with its shorter version, the playsuit, this easy, all-in-one statement piece will be gracing our stores this summer in all the latest prints. Just one, and you’re done!
title: Text Title

_items.body: Fresh, white Demi jumpsuit by Staple the Label ($139.95), summer ready with straw fedora, slides and printed headscarf
Printed floral jumpsuit by City Chic ($129.95) up for a summer-fun evening with heeled sandals and Piper Livia pouch
Wide-leg tie-waist floral jumpsuit by Tokito ($99.95; exclusive to Myer) – an absolute knockout with killer heels
Awakening floral jumpsuit by Basque ($149.95; exclusive to Myer) swinging into summer with complementary red heeled sandals and blue tassel earrings

_items.text:
• Jumpsuits can be worn both casually, with flats, or as a luxe evening or race-day outfit teamed with killer heels and big, bold statement jewellery. Paired with a jacket, they even make great workwear.


• Prints are big this season, but you also can’t go wrong with an all-white jumpsuit (all white is alright!) – the perfect solution for a jumpsuit novice, and the perfect foil for summer.


• This season’s jumpsuits are super flattering, being fitted at the waist and with wide-legged pants.

body:
❝

That’s such a fabulous Jayson Brunsdon jumpsuit you’ve chosen. If you like all-in-one outfits, can I show you a couple of playsuits too? They’re perfect for high summer and a must when packing for holidays.


This Piper scarf is the perfect accessory for that jumpsuit you’re trying on. Would you like me to show you a few ways to wear it?


❞
title: Text Title

body: Piper, Basque, Jayson Brunsdon, Tokito Collection, Milk & Honey, Miss Shop, LA Collective, Wayne Cooper Events and national brands and concessions
title: Text Title

body: This summer doesn’t have to be solely about skirts, dresses and shorts, which is great news for the pant lovers among us! Find countless lightweight and summer-friendly versions in-store, incorporating the latest trends: wide legs, flares, linen, yarn-dyed stripes, high-waisted paper bag, cropped, hem details and printed.
title: Text Title

_items.body: Linen-blend wide-leg belted pant by Piper ($89.95; exclusive to Myer) – the perfect summer companion
Tie-waist pant by Milk & Honey ($69.95; exclusive to Myer) ready for anything with black crop knit cami, heeled sandals and baker boy hat
Black linen-blend pant by Miss Shop ($59.95; exclusive to Myer) taking it easy with white trainers and stripey top
Wide-leg pant by Piper ($89.95; exclusive to Myer) – a traffic-stopping workwear solution paired with red floral blouse and red accessories

_items.text:
• When wearing wide-legged pants, tops definitely look best tucked in.


• Anything goes when it comes to the summer pant and shoes – slides, trainers, sandals – although wide-legged pants create a particularly striking silhouette with high heels.


• Form-fitting or cropped tops are most flattering with high-waisted paper-bag pants, as they balance the proportions of the outfit.

body:
❝

Natural fabrics are big this season. Can I show you some rattan accessories that would complement those Miss Shop linen pants beautifully?


There’s a lovely knit cami that goes with those cropped Milk & Honey pants. Would you like to try them together?


❞
title: Text Title

body: Piper, Milk & Honey, Miss Shop, Basque and national brands and concessions
title: Text Title

body: It’s back to nature this spring/summer, when neutral colours and au naturel fibres will reign supreme. Put on a pretty yarn-died linen dress, slip into your espadrilles and get ready to brunch.
title: Text Title

_items.body: Pinstripe summer suit by Piper (jacket $169.95, pant $99.95; exclusive to Myer) in natural cotton and linen complemented by wooden drop earrings
Grey Aerin top and Yves pant with ruched white Alessandra shirt by FWRD The Label (top $179, pant $189, shirt $189) – a neutral knockout with loop drop earrings
Pastel jumpsuit by Piper ($129.95; exclusive to Myer) with the perfect basket-weave accessory: the Piper Bari circle crossbody bag

Other au naturel accessories (all exclusive to Myer; clockwise from top left): Rafaela cranberry sandal by Piper ($119.95); Lilli sandal by Miss Shop ($69.95); Audrey natural canvas sandal by Piper ($89.95); and Hilly crossbody bag by Piper ($79.95)
Check button-through dress by Piper ($129.95; exclusive to Myer) nodding to nature with straw belt and tote and neutral sandals

_items.text:
• Soft checks and stripes go beautifully with this trend.


• Neutrals work best with natural, basket-weave accessories – think items made from straw, wicker and rattan – with details like tortoiseshell buttons. Resin jewellery completes the organic effect.


• The more worn in something looks, the better. Linen, naturally derived viscose and Tencel, cotton, ramie and jersey are all great fabrics for achieving the laundered effect.

body:
❝

That’s such a classic white shirt you’ve chosen. Can I show you how great it looks with this terracotta jacket? Warm and neutral summer tones are big this season.


Let me show you how to style that checked Piper dress with a straw belt and tote.


❞
title: Text Title

body: Piper, Regatta, Trent Nathan, Milk & Honey, Miss Shop and national brands and concessions
title: Text Title

body: It’s not often you’re allowed to be black and white about things in life, but this season’s monochrome trend will change all that. We’re going dotty for black-and-white dots – polka, linear, small, big, spliced – and all types of stripes. Think of it as this season’s palette cleanser, an antidote to all the florals.
title: Text Title

_items.body: Hopscotch jumpsuit by Stella ($169) mirrored beautifully by Piper’s Hilly circle crossbody bag
Embroidered-yoke boho dress by Grab Denim ($129.95; exclusive to Myer) looking mono-tastic with black bag and black heels
Fitted ivory-with-black-spot dress by Wayne Cooper Events ($179.95; exclusive to Myer) dazzling with a striking ruffle accent
Wide-legged striped pant by Piper 16-22 ($99.95; exclusive to Myer) paired with other seasonal must-haves: a ruched-sleeve top and natural-fibre sandals
Spotted ruffle-shoulder jumpsuit by Jayson Brunsdon Black Label ($229.95; exclusive to Myer) accented with simple pops of red

_items.text:
• Polka dots are huge this season, adorning everything from playful tops to spring-racing outfits.


• Striped skirts, particularly with asymmetrical hems, are also must-have items.


• Given the boldness of this trend, accessories can be kept simple: plain, solid colours and natural textures and fibres work best.

body:
❝

There’s a really cute circle-shaped crossbody bag that complements that polka-dot Stella jumpsuit perfectly. Would you like to see it?


Those striped wide-legged Piper pants look best with a plain white top. Can I get you one to try on?


❞
title: Text Title

body: Jayson Brunsdon, Grab Denim, Wayne Cooper Events, Piper, Tokito, Basque and national brands and concessions
title: Text Title

body: It’s all in the detail this season, the feminine detail that is. Ruching is particularly hot, showing up everywhere from skirts to sleeves to maxi dresses, and livening up silhouettes with its nostalgic technique. Ruffles, draped material and florals are other essential feminine embellishments to add to your fashion repertoire this spring/summer.
title: Text Title

_items.body: Titania high-neck dress by Cooper St ($169.95) with gorgeous tropical floral print, ruching detail and must-have-this-summer Miss Shop Madison sandals
Oversized, ruched-sleeve spot blouse by Wayne Cooper ($129.95; exclusive to Myer) rocking the ruching and mono trends
Draw-shoulder tiered maxi dress from Leona by Leona Edmiston ($229.59; exclusive to Myer) in a pretty ditsy floral and with asymmetrical hem
Embroidered and ruched empire dress by Wayne Cooper ($249.95; exclusive to Myer) – an absolute show-stopper in tropical floral

_items.text:
• Ruching is a very flattering type of fabric manipulation; it works a treat on figure-hugging dresses.


• Embrace the big things in florals this season: tropical florals (large, bold prints on a dark background) and ‘ditsy’ florals (pretty, intricate prints).


• The feminine detailing is the focal point, so you can keep your accessories to a minimum.

body:
❝

That ruched Wayne Cooper dress looks stunning on you. Can I show you the perfect high-heeled sandals to wear with it?


This Leona by Leona Edmiston maxi dress encompasses so many of this season’s must-have trends: ditsy floral, ruching, draped fabric and an asymmetrical hem. Would you like to try it on?


❞
title: Text Title

body: Wayne Cooper, Leona by Leona Edmiston, Jayson Brunsdon, Piper, Basque, Tokito, Tokito Collection, LA Collective, Miss Shop and national brands and concessions
title: Text Title

body: Does denim ever go out of style? We think not. This season it’s not so much about what denim you’re wearing, but how you’re wearing it and what you’re coordinating it with, whether that be casual tees, sweats and jackets or dressier tops to take it into the workplace.
title: Text Title

_items.body: Slim-leg stretch-denim pant by Regatta ($59.95; exclusive to Myer) looking elegant and weekend-ready with a paisley printed blouse
Denim mini skirt by Superdry ($89.95) walking the talk with matching Superdry sweat and Miss Shop Madison sandals
Classic denim pinafore by Miss Shop ($49.95; exclusive to Myer) oozing casual cool with white trainers and tee
Petites essential crop jean by Regatta ($59.95; exclusive to Myer), effortlessly styled with neutral sandals and relaxed printed shirt

_items.text:
• Embrace this season’s colour trends in denim too, including white and pastel denim.


• Jeans are going back to quite classic styles, but with a bit of an edge – in particular, a frayed edge.


• Try wearing your denim jeans and skirts in different ways this summer: with a printed shirt, off-the-shoulder top, graphic tee, light outerwear or even a dress-and-jean combo.

body:
❝

Denim jeans can be so versatile these days. Can I show you how this Wayne Cooper top can transform that pair you’ve chosen into a perfect work outfit?


Logo tees and sweats are so hot coordinated with denim right now. Would you like me to get you a few tops to try on with that skirt?


❞
title: Text Title

body: Regatta, Grab, Miss Shop and national brands and concessions
title: Text Title

body: This summer, going to the beach is about much more than just swimwear – it’s about creating an entire beach-to-bar look, complete with cover-up, beach bag and hat. You’ll find dozens of styling solutions across our stores and something to suit all body shapes, including plenty of one pieces, which remain the key swimwear item for the season.
title: Text Title

_items.body: One-piece bathers by Piper Swim ($89.95; exclusive to Myer) sporting the feminine flourishes of ruffles and ruching
Bikini from Cozi by Jennifer Hawkins (top $59.95, bottom $59.95; exclusive to Myer) with tie-side bottom and stand-out-from-the-crowd animal print
Dress-shirt with lace bib by Regatta ($79.95; exclusive to Myer) – the perfect lightweight and cool beach cover-up
Sardegna natural tote bag (left) and Tropea pink tote bag, both by Piper ($79.95 each; both exclusive to Myer) – your beach-gear carrying essentials!

Waterfall kimono with one piece (left) and spotty two piece, all by Miss Shop Swim (kimono $49.95, one piece $39.95, bikini top $24.95, bottom $19.95; all exclusive to Myer) – absolutely fab swimwear solutions

_items.text:
• There are two things to remember this summer: the one piece is hero, and the kaftan is queen!


• An alternative to the kaftan is wearing wide-leg linen pants as a cover-up over bathers.


• Prints are on trend – look out for dots and florals – as are this season’s colours (reds, yellows, pastels).

body:
❝

Would you like me to show you how to style the bathers you’ve chosen? I can create a whole look for you with matching kaftan, bag and headscarf. You’ll be a knockout on the beach!


That black one piece looks fantastic on you. Would you like to also try this pair of black bathers with white polka dots? Dots are massive this summer.


❞
title: Text Title

body: Piper, Miss Shop, Regatta and national brands and concessions
title: Text Title

body: It’s certainly looking like a colourful spring/summer! We’ll be washing away the winter (dark) blues and blacks with bright primary colours – yellow, red (flowing on from winter into raspberry) and cobalt blue. Pale blues will also shine, alongside other pastels to balance out all the rainbow brights.
title: Text Title

_items.body: Button-detail cobalt-blue blazer by Basque ($159.95; exclusive to Myer) contrasting powerfully with simple black and white garments and accessories
Dazzling Peacock cocktail dress by Maticevski ($1350) in yellow – the new millennial pink

Wrap-front jumpsuit in Floral Paradise (by Jayson Brunsdon Black Label; $249.95), pastel-blue Poppy crossbody (Piper; $79.95) and Adore tote (Leona by Leona Edmiston; $119.95) – all putting the perfection into pastel (and all exclusive to Myer)
Red jumpsuit by Jayson Brunsdon Black Label ($229.95; exclusive to Myer) cutting a striking silhouette with ruffle detail and black wedges

_items.text:
• When it comes to colour, head to toe is definitely one way to go! Nothing says sartorial confidence more than dressing in multiple pieces in the same or similar shades.


• Try mixing pastels with pops of this season’s hot colours, including colourful floral prints, or even going pastel on pastel.


• Neutrals are a great way to tone down bolder colours; for example, beige counterbalances daffodil yellow beautifully.

body:
❝

Have you seen these Miss Shop Madison heeled sandals? They come in seven on-trend shades and are a great way to add a splash of colour to any outfit.


That cobalt blue blazer looks fantastic worn with simple black and white pieces. Would you like me to show you how to style it?


❞
title: Text Title

body: All MEB brands and national brands and concessions
title: Text Title

_incorrect.final:
Good effort, but not quite. 


Feminine flourishes, jumpsuits and natural fibres are three of the nine key trends to look out for this spring/summer18.

_partlyCorrect.final:
Good effort, but not quite. 


Feminine flourishes, jumpsuits and natural fibres are three of the nine key trends to look out for this spring/summer18.

_feedback.correct:
Well done! You're definitely up with the latest in fashion. 


Feminine flourishes, jumpsuits and natural fibres are three of the nine key trends to look out for this spring/summer18.

body: Which of the following are trends for spring/summer18? Select all that are correct.
title: Knowledge Check

displayTitle: We’d love to hear your thoughts on this Learning Moment! Please press the Comment button below to let us know what you thought of it. All feedback welcome and gratefully received!
title: Text Title
